 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶשֶׁר‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Deut.32.11|Deut 32:11]]</sup> ==griffon-vulture, eagle== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***našru***</u></abbr>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַשְׁרָא‎</span>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***vulture*** ([[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>2780</sup>), vulgar <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>641</sup>; Sabean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נסר‎</span> proper name, of deity, and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ביתן נסר‎</span> [[BDB#DHM|DHM]]<sup>ZMG. xxix (1875), 600</sup>; xxxvii (1883), 356); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Hos.8.1|Hos 8:1]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָָֽשֶׁד‎</span> [[Deut.28.49|Deut 28:49]] +; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְשָׁרִים‎</span> [[2Sam.1.23|2Sam 1:23]] +, construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִשְׁרֵי‎</span> [[Lam.4.19|Lam 4:19]] — sometimes (perhaps not always) the ***griffon-vulture*** ([[BDB#Tristr|Tristr]]<sup>NHB 172 ff.</sup> [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>[[Deut.14.12|Deut 14:12]]</sup> [[BDB#Now|Now]]<sup>Archi i. 84</sup> [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>2780</sup>), [[Mic.1.16|Mic 1:16]] (bald, in simile) flying swiftly to pery [[Hab.1.8|Hab 1:8]]; [[Job.9.26|Job 9:26]], compare [[Prov.30.17|Prov 30:17]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּנֵינֿ‎</span>, unclean [[Lev.11.13|Lev 11:13]]; [[Deut.14.12|Deut 14:12]] soaring [[Job.30.27|Job 30:27]], also in simile [[Prov.23.5|Prov 23:5]]; [[Isa.40.31|Isa 40:31]]; [[Obad.1.4|Obad 1:4]], building nest high [[Jer.49.16|Jer 49:16]] (compare also [[Job.39.27|Job 39:27]]); as swift also [[2Sam.1.23|2Sam 1:23]], especially of Babylonian and Assyr. invader [[Jer.4.13|Jer 4:13]]; [[Lam.4.19|Lam 4:19]], compare [[Hos.8.1|Hos 8:1]]; [[Deut.28.49|Deut 28:49]]; [[Jer.48.40|Jer 48:40]]; [[Jer.49.22|Jer 49:22]] (all in comparisons), <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַנֶּשֶׁר הַגָּדוֺל‎</span> [[Ezek.17.3|Ezek 17:3]] (figurativeof Nebuch.), v[[Ezek.17.7|Ezek 17:7]] (figurative of king of Egypt); leaving no trace of light [[Prov.30.19|Prov 30:19]] as renewing youth (by moulting) [[Ps.103.5|Ps 103:5]] as training and supporting its young [[Exod.19.4|Exod 19:4]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Deut.32.11|Deut 32:11]] (song); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּני נ‎</span> of cherubim in vision [[Ezek.1.10|Ezek 1:10]]; [[Ezek.10.4|Ezek 10:4]]. — Only [[Mic.1.16|Mic 1:16]] seems to compel reference to vulture (on eating fresh carrion by eagles see references in [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Lev.11.13|Lev 11:13]]</sup>), and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> may be a more comprehensive word, including both vulture and eagle.
